column4: can anyone help me manually remove firestarter?  I did a kernal upgrade to get my battery to show up, and I didn't know to do iptables, and now firestarter is in a constant broken state, and it always says so when I do anything apt-get related
you can do that, but have you tried to repair the package data first?
what was you answer to my question about trying to repair the package data?
try running synaptic and selecting the repair option from the menu
can you paste the error you are getting to the 'paste bot?
if it's a one liner you can paste it here, or two lines
you did that, with sudo?  sudo dpkg --configure -a     ?
I'm just not convinced that uninstalling is going to make any difference
we have to find the root of the problem
sorry, I know you've told us twice, but run through it again for me, what you did that got you into this situation.
I thought you had asked about removing, sorry if that's wrong
why not add the iptables support?
do you need firestarter for some reason?
ok, give us the exact text of one of those errors
I'm not sure if you answered; what is the exact text of the error you get?
aptitude is another front end to apt-get, like synaptic.  irrelevant to this problem
that's some wall you've got there.
